intro: Asterocephalus cochinchinensis, commonly known as the Vietnamese starhead, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its leaves are lance-shaped and aromatic, while the small white or yellow flowers appear in clusters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and understudied species.
